title_sort: justus f. boyd to walt whitman, 27 april 1863
title: Justus F. Boyd to Walt Whitman, 27 April 1863
text: Friend WhitmanI havent[haven't] rec'd any letter from you yet and I begin to think you have forgoten[forgotten] to write but I will try once or twice more and if I dont[don't] get an answer I surely shall think something is up I have written this makes three times to you and no ans yet.My health is some better than it was when I left the Hospital, but I am not well by a good deal and I dont[don't] know as I ever shall be able to work on a farm again I am now in a store. I cant tell how long I shall stay but I think some of staying all summer The place where I am in now is a pleasnt[pleasant] little village called Byron its a very pleasnt[pleasant] place. Well now how do you get along in Washington. I suppose you still go to the Hospital well that is all right but I havnt[haven't] seen such a thing since I left Washington Now how much do you think I could get a month down where you are or couldnt[couldn't] I get any thing Please excuse Bad writing & poor spelling and write as soon as you get this I am not a going to write much this time for it may never get to you if I get an Ans to this I will write longer next time Justus F. Boyd to Walt Whitman, 27 April 1863
